Comments_List: I learned valuable skills both about analyzing text, and grammar.
My writing became exponentially better. My reading and analyzarion skills also got much better.
How to closely analyze many different kinds of pieces
This class improves your critical reading and thinking skills. It encourages you to think holistically about the importance of reading and literature.
The work load can be unvaried, some nights work takes less than an hour when other nights the homework can range to three or four hours.
Might have been a little bit too much reading material. Strengths- great professor, super engaging, loved attending class, challenged me but it was still very fun

Strengths: Clear feedback from the instructor, supportive classroom environment that encourages all students to participate, frequent and meaningful discussions about the selected readings, great use of university libraries as resources
Weaknesses: sometimes there was not enough time to fully discuss each assigned reading.

Strengths- interesting readings, very engaged professor

Weaknesses- too many readings to discuss per class period

Excellent response to student concern
The professor was clearly engaged in students work
This course is great, but it would be awesome to spend more time discussing each reading (which is unrealistic given the small amlunt of class time allowed)
Absolutely! This course was one of my favorites despite english historically not being my favorite class.
Yes, great class. Learned a lot and was very engaging

Professor Reider is one of the sweetest professors I have met in my couple years at Yale. She's very enthusiastic about teaching her class and ultimately makes it something to look forward to each day. She's more than willing to meet outside of class just to help you improve your writing skills and/or talk about pieces of reading that have been covered in class. Take this class if possible!!
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student who is looking to improve their writing skills as the classroom environment really promotes personal growth.
I would recommend this course because it offered many different types of reading and truly allowed for growth in my writing.
YES ABSOLUTELY, BEST CLASS AT YALE
